headline: Chicken Piccata with Capers
description: This is a quick and easy recipe for chicken piccata is an Italian classic with a sauce of capers, garlic, lemon juice, and white wine.
name: Chicken Piccata with Capers
recipeIngredient: 4 (6 ounce) skinless, boneless chicken breast halves

recipeInstructions.text: Place each chicken breast between 2 sheets of heavy-duty plastic wrap. Pound breasts to 1/2-inch thickness using a meat mallet or small heavy skillet.
Spread flour into a wide, shallow dish. Press chicken into flour to coat completely.

Melt butter with olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat; cook chicken in hot butter mixture until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 3 to 5 minutes per side. Remove chicken from skillet to a serving platter and cover with a lid to keep warm.

Pour white wine, lemon juice, capers, and garlic into the pan. Bring the liquid to a boil while scraping the browned bits of food from the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon; cook at a boil until slightly thickened, about 2 minutes. Season the mixture with salt and pepper.
Drizzle sauce over and around the chicken; garnish with parsley.

review.reviewBody: Amazing!!! I didn't have any wine on hand so I used apple cider vinegar after looking up good substitutions. This is definitely going on the family meal rotation.
Outstanding and so easy. I added artichokes - Yum! Next time I will use more white wine & lemon juice.

Really liked it. Had all the ingredients. Needed minor tweaking so I couldn't do 5 stars. Once I tasted the overwhelming lemon flavor, I tweaked it and ended up cooking the sauce down for about 6-7 minutes. Added shallots, extra garlic (lots), freshly ground pepper and about 1/4 cup chicken broth. Last couple minutes I remembered I had mushrooms so added a few. Only thing I will remember to do next time is to put the chicken back into the sauce for a minute to warm it back up. I also used brown rice flour instead of all purpose and really love how light of texture it gives to the chicken. Its undetectable but adds something.
So good! I didn't make any adjustments. Served with angel hair pasta and broccoli :)
This recipe was not only very easy to put together, but so delicious. I have shared it with many others. I look forward to making it again!!

The sauce was too thin and not enough. I whisked together an additional 1/4 C of white wine & 1/4 C water with a TBSP flour. Whisked into the pan until thickened. I served with couscous and asparagus.
I should have used thinner chicken breasts (had to cook them a bit longer) and a tad less lemon juice but it was delish!

This was very tasty. I made it as directed except for me the sauce was a bit watery so I mix in some corn starch in a bit of water. The capers and white wine added just the right amount of tang. This recipe is now added to my rotation.
Clear instructions, quick meal, able to top on rice.
Loved it!
I loved this recipe and so did the hubby! Only thing I changed was I added a tablespoon of butter at the end to smooth out the sauce a bit. Was amazing!!

This recipe is great! I made it per instructions but forgot the garlic (we love garlic) but otherwise followed recipe. My husband and I loved it. Will add to 2-3 week dinner rotation. I used pre-sliced chicken breasts from grocery store. Served with butter lemon potatoes and green beans. Yummy!
Very good, just need to use less lemon and a little extra flour to make a creamier sauce and it will be perfect next time.

Absolutely delicious. Will definitely make this again
I made this exactly as written. Excellent!

I also followed the suggestion of another reviewer and put the whole chicken breasts back in the sauce to finish cooking. The chicken was super tender and really absorbed the flavors of the sauce. I served it with buttered egg noodles. Will definitely make this again!!!!

Excellent. Very easy to prepare

Really easy and exactly what I was looking for.

Pounding the breasts nice and thin is important and can be done well ahead of time and placed in the fridge between sheets of waxed paper. Do not overcook. Excellent with hot buttered noodles and a fresh green vegetable.
Changes made, were the addition of mushrooms and more butter. will make on a regular basis.
So delicious and flavorful!

Made this but left out the olive oil, and used 2 Tbspoons butter. I pounded the chicken breast halves between a couple sheets of freezer paper, using a kitchen mallet that was my mom's. It was easy, quick and delicious! I served it with herbed thyme, rosemary and oregano artisan bread from the store, instead of pasta. I'll make this again!
Quick and so delicious!
This was delicious only change was doubled the sauce for some penne pasta with it. Yum
Delicious every time. I have made with capers but tonight I was out of capers so I made it with fresh rosemary.
I really liked this dish. Great recipe
Very easy. The chicken was moist, but I thought it could have used a little more zing. I might also thicken the sauce with some corn starch next time.

This was a quick and easy dinner, but I didnâ€™t really care for it. I thought it was very bitter and I ended up putting 5 or 6 drops of stevia sweetener in it before serving. Maybe it was the wine...I used what I had open - Pinot Grigio. There are two other chicken piccata recipes on the site that are much better. Otherwise, I followed the recipe to the letter and it was perfect.

I make this all the time for my vegetarian boyfriend, using Quorn brand or Gardein brand imitation chicken cutlets. This is his favorite dish in the world, and I like it because it is fast and easy. Except for the substitution of plant-based protein for chicken (and note that the imitation chicken does not get pounded flat), the recipe can be made just as it is.

Once the chicken was done and set aside, I let some mushrooms sautÃ© right before adding in the rest of the sauce ingredients. It was Super easy, the only change I made was to use chicken cutlets, so no pounding! An easy meals that takes no time at all.

So wanted a recipe for Piccata with capers that used chicken and not veal. I loved this! I only used two large chicken breast halves. Same amount of flour, butter and olive oil. I cut the wine 1/4 cup, 1/8 cup lemon juice, 1 tablespoon capers, 1 tablespoon garlic. I added 1 teaspoon paprika and 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt and 1/4 teaspoon fresh ground pepper to the flour. 
Turned out incredibly well. Will make this over again.
Reminds me of my German experience.

This came out really well. The chicken was moist and the leftovers were just as good. I added quite a few capers and extra lemon because we like that tart flavor. I served this over riced cauliflower which was outstanding!
A little more lemon juice. Overall very good recipe
The only change I made was that I added Parmesan cheese to the flour before dredging.
Delish!

This recipe was so quick and easy. The hardest part was hammering the chicken. I think I'll make this more often.
This will be forwarded to my son. He doesn't cook much, but it's easy, it's quick, and the end results will impress his company.

Yummy! I made this for company and put it over spaghetti squash, like one of the reviewers mentioned- delicious! The lemon makes the dish taste nice and light and the wine compliments it beautifully. I will definitely be making this again!

This is a great recipe. I like that it goes together so quickly. Great for a weeknight meal, but fancy enough for company. We love the taste of capers, it combines beautifully with the sauce and chicken. The chicken came out tender and moist. Served with mashed potatoes and green beans. Thank you Sandra1980!
This is ok but tastes very pickled. Need to double or even triple sauce.
Very good. Made as written, as I think every review should be based on the recipe as is. Really enjoyed it, wouldn't change a thing!
My family absolutely loved this! The sauce was tangy, delicious and the overall recipe was fairly easy to prepare. A winner!

Will make again. Fairly simple for a working parent to prepare. I used frozen chicken tenders (a cheat) and after defrosting tenderized them between two sheets of waxed paper with a mallet. 

I didn't have white wine and used white wine vinegar instead. The sauce was quite tart so I may cut the lemon next time.

Not quite as good as Chef John's Quick Chicken Piccata. Not sure why. Recipes are very similar. With the size of supermarket breasts these days, I had to double the sauce ingredients just to have enough. I would have cut the breasts in half had I thought of it. They were enormous. It would have fed a minimum of six people with leftovers.
This recipes is a keeper.

This recipe has been a classic and is very simple to make. This recipe incorporates all the proper flavors , the white wine being a very nice touch for the sauce. Haven't changed a thing, comes out perfect every time! However sometimes for faster cooking I will use chicken tenders vs chicken breasts.
Came out delicious. I usually go for the veal picata when I can find it on a menu out to eat... this matched my favorite (but with chicken of course) and was easy enough to make.
I have tried this recipe several times & haven't made any changes to recipe ! This very very delicious & so simple to make! My husband agrees!

I was a little hesitant to try this because It had so few ratings but I made this for my husband last night and he really loved it. The only thing I did differently was I cooked the sauce and chicken together instead of taking out the chicken and pouring the sauce later. I think it allowed the chicken to absorb more of the flavor. Anyway, give it a try because this is a winner!

I made this recipe without dredging the chicken in flour (as I was looking to make a grain free dish). I sauteed seasoned chicken tenderloins in coconut oil.
I served it over baked spaghetti squash with a little shredded parmesan on top. Both my husband and I found the sauce to be too lemony and/or tart. However, it was a good base. I will make it again, but next time I will probably cut the lemon in half, decrease the capers and add some butter (which perhaps I was missing because I didn't cook the chicken in butter).
